dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: 'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos
News Content: This is The Takeaway from today's Morning Brief, which you can sign up to receive in your inbox every morning along with:

The chart of the day What we're watching What we're reading Economic data releases and earnings

Coverage of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, each year is something I view as a competitive sport.

I actually start training for the intense week over the summer, as my few close friends know (and yes, they all make fun of me). The number of workouts every week in the lead-up rises incrementally so I can easily sprint up and down the two-mile promenade with a backpack to stuff in as many meetings as humanly possible (yes, I do this).

My one cheat meal a week gets replaced by green drinks and extra doses of vitamins to ensure I don't get sick. I meditate twice a day and carefully pick out clothes I know will help me execute at the highest level. Look good, feel good, good things happen.

To me, this one event is the closest I will get to being like Michael Jordan in the playoffs — and I am very lucky to be in attendance.

And this year, the gathering of the elites flying in on private jets to wax poetic on the world's biggest problems will be extra nutty.

Read more: Here are the biggest global risks for 2025

The conference unofficially kicks off on Trump's Inauguration Day. Some CEOs I know who normally would be at Davos all week are dropping in mid-week after working the inauguration party rounds. By Tuesday, the newly minted president may have uncorked a host of executive orders that could impact the businesses of the top CEOs on the ground. And, of course, impact the global markets.

This is why this year's WEF will be more important than the norm for you, the average investor. The headlines will be coming in hot and heavy as CEOs look to challenge Trump or get on his good side. They will also look to talk up their businesses ahead of the start of earnings season, and with markets getting a little rockier of late.

Here's what yours truly and our very own Jennifer Schonberger will be watching while bundled up in five layers all week. Be sure to bookmark the "streaming now" section on Yahoo Finance to catch all our market-moving interviews in real time. Or tune in where you normally catch us, whether that's on Samsung TV or our nifty app.

Unlike our previous trips to Davos over the past decade, I will be taping several special episodes of the Opening Bid podcast on the ground. I could tell you who those guests will be, but where is the fun in that? Best to be surprised!

Story Continues

Now, on to that guide...

Big bank CEOs: The biggest names in banking, such as JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon, Bank of America (BAC) CEO Brian Moynihan, Goldman Sachs (GS) CEO David Solomon, Citi (C) CEO Jane Fraser, and Morgan Stanley (MS) CEO Ted Pick will be in attendance. While this group will all get asked about Trump policies, it's going to be their outlook on interest rates that will be most key to market sentiment. Most have not spoken publicly since the Fed signaled a likely halt in rate cuts last month, and they will want to be heard ahead of the Fed's Jan. 28-29 policy meeting.

The tariff CEOs: Retail will have a nice showing at Davos, with the CEOs of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL), Williams Sonoma (WSM), and Gap (GAP) (their CEO's first time at the event) making the rounds. These companies are right in the middle of the tariff debate. I'll be interested in how they are preparing for Trump tariffs from a supply chain perspective. I am also interested in how much they could raise prices post-tariffs — it could offer valuable insight into the 2025 inflation outlook and Fed policy.

Read more: How do tariffs work, and who really pays them?

The race to catch Nvidia: It will be another year of artificial intelligence chatter throughout the halls of Davos. This time, I think the discussions will take two forms. First, unlike last year, where the AI discussions were mostly about potential, investors are going to want to see clear lines to revenue and profits. So I encourage AI CEOs to bring it. And two, we will probably hear more about how Big Tech players in Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are aiming to develop their own high-powered AI chips to catch Nvidia (NVDA), or at least make good enough chips to diversify. Leaders from OpenAI and Anthropic will also be in attendance, and their thoughts on chips could be key. I'll be watching Nvidia's stock price like a hawk this week, and you should be as well.

Crypto delegation: The crypto industry has had a solid presence at Davos in the past five years. This year, the industry is expected to be out in force, headlined by an appearance from Coinbase (COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong. I'll be quite attuned to what the crypto crowd thinks about the latest volatility in bitcoin, MicroStrategy's (MSTR) bitcoin buying binge, what they are hearing from the pro-crypto Trump administration, and early assessments on Paul Atkins as the likely next SEC chairman.

And of course, the new Trump coin that debuted to much fanfare (and market cap) on Friday.

The token quickly rose to a market cap of $73 billion in about 48 hours, surpassing DOGE as the largest meme coin so far.

The market cap of the crypto has since dropped to $12 billion from its launch, according to CoinMarketCap.

Stocks: Stocks are beginning to look top-heavy (especially the Magnificent 7), as I have reported. I'm eager to hear from market pros such as JPMorgan's Mary Erdoes and economic experts like Nouriel Roubini on whether they are seeing red flags on the horizon. Any calls they make at this Davos may hold greater weight given more volatile market conditions and increased Trump policy uncertainty.

The political wild cards: As of this writing, contacts have told me President-elect Donald Trump plans to send delegates to Davos. Who precisely gets the nod is the wild card. (I fancy it will be potential Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, a Davos party scene regular for many years. Elon has long hated Davos, so hard to see him appearing). Trump himself is slated to give a speech remotely on Thursday, a source told Yahoo Finance.

But who ultimately shows up from Trump's orbit — and what they say once touching down — could set the tone on US international relations right out of the gate. If a delegate arrives at Davos days after Trump takes actions that could weigh on the economic growth of foreign countries and then aims to explain the actions, best believe the inevitable headlines may not be so market-friendly.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram, and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's positive view on Apple, indicating that it is a significant holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. While Buffett did not label Apple as a 'forever stock' in his latest letter, his praise suggests confidence in its long-term potential. Additionally, the overall bullish sentiment from analysts regarding Apple, combined with its strong market position and historical performance, supports a higher probability of stock price increase. However, the mention of other stocks like Chevron and Coca-Cola as better options for income investors may create some downward pressure on Apple's stock in the short term. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a higher likelihood of a price rise due to Buffett's endorsement, but with some risk of a fall due to competitive comparisons.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline and content primarily focus on the institutional ownership of Apple (AAPL). While high institutional ownership is generally seen as a positive sign, indicating confidence in the company, the article also points out the potential vulnerability of the stock price to institutional trading decisions. The article also mentions recent insider sales, which could be interpreted negatively. The general public ownership is also significant, but not enough to counter institutional decisions. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, highlighting potential risks associated with institutional ownership. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is slightly higher than a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news headline, "Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025", is completely irrelevant to Apple Inc.  Apple is already a publicly traded company; therefore, this news about upcoming IPOs has no direct impact on its stock price. Any price movement in AAPL would be due to other market factors, not this news.  The probabilities are therefore assigned based on the assumption that the news has no effect.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' does not directly mention Apple Inc. (AAPL) or provide any specific information about the company. Since the news is unrelated to Apple's business operations, financial performance, or market position, it is unlikely to have a significant impact on Apple's stock price. Therefore, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling due to this news are minimal and largely neutral.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. The article mentions various CEOs, including those from big banks and tech companies, who will be in attendance. It also discusses the potential for Trump's policies to impact the market and the possibility of interest rate changes. The article specifically mentions Apple Inc. is not directly mentioned, but the tech industry and related companies such as Microsoft, Alphabet, and Nvidia are discussed. Given the broad discussion of the tech industry and the potential for market volatility, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price rising or falling based on the overall market sentiment and the potential impact of the discussions at Davos on the tech industry.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a positive outlook on various sectors including tech due to anticipated policy shifts favoring reduced regulations and increased M&A activities under the Trump administration. Given that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a major player in the tech sector, this news is likely to have a positive impact on its stock price. However, the article also mentions risks associated with automakers and construction, which might introduce a slight level of caution.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's positive view on Apple, emphasizing its significance in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. Buffett's praise suggests confidence in Apple's long-term potential, which typically supports a bullish sentiment among investors. However, the article also mentions that other stocks, particularly Chevron and Coca-Cola, are being recommended for income investors, which could create some downward pressure on Apple's stock in the short term. Overall, the positive endorsement from Buffett and the strong market position of Apple lead to a higher probability of stock price increase, despite some competitive concerns.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news focuses on the high institutional ownership of Apple (61%). While this can be seen as a positive sign, indicating confidence from large investors, the article also points out the vulnerability of the stock price to institutional trading decisions. The article mentions that 41% of the business is held by the top 25 shareholders, implying that a significant portion of the stock is controlled by a relatively small group. Recent insider sales are also mentioned, which could be interpreted negatively. Considering these factors, I believe there's a slightly higher chance of the stock price falling due to potential institutional selling pressure or negative sentiment from insider sales. However, the overall positive sentiment associated with high institutional ownership prevents a significantly high probability of a price drop. The previous rounds show a wide range of predictions, with some models focusing on irrelevant news and others providing more balanced assessments. Given the specific information in this news piece, I'm leaning towards a slightly negative outlook.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline, "Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025," is irrelevant to Apple's stock price.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, mostly stemming from interpreting other, unprovided news sources.  Several models correctly identified the irrelevance of the provided headline.  Given the lack of relevant information in the provided news, and the wide divergence in predictions based on assumed external information, I will assign probabilities reflecting a neutral stance.  The slight bias towards a rise reflects the generally positive sentiment towards Apple in the market, independent of this specific news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' is unrelated to Apple Inc. (AAPL) as it focuses on upcoming initial public offerings and does not provide any direct information about Apple's business operations, financial performance, or market position. Given the irrelevance of the news to Apple, it is unlikely to have any significant impact on the company's stock price. Previous predictions from other models also reflect this, with most assigning neutral or minimal probabilities to price movements. Therefore, the probabilities are set to reflect no significant impact from this news.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline discusses the stock playbook for Trump's second term, highlighting top sector winners and losers. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a major player in the tech sector, which is expected to benefit from lighter regulations and increased investment in AI under the Trump administration. Several tech leaders, including Apple's CEO Tim Cook, have contributed funds to Trump's inauguration campaign, indicating a positive relationship. Additionally, analysts like Wedbush's Dan Ives predict a 'Goldilocks' scenario for Big Tech, expecting tech stocks to rise by 25% in 2025. Therefore, the overall sentiment suggests a higher probability of Apple's stock price rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. Although Apple Inc. is not directly mentioned, the tech industry and related companies such as Microsoft, Alphabet, and Nvidia are discussed. The article highlights the potential for Trump's policies to impact the market and the possibility of interest rate changes. Given the broad discussion of the tech industry and the potential for market volatility, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price rising or falling based on the overall market sentiment and the potential impact of the discussions at Davos on the tech industry. The presence of big bank CEOs and their outlook on interest rates, as well as the discussions on artificial intelligence and crypto, may influence the market. However, without direct mention of Apple, the impact on its stock price is uncertain. Considering the mixed predictions from other models and the lack of direct information about Apple in the news, I assign a moderate probability to both a rise and a fall in stock price.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a positive outlook on various sectors including tech due to anticipated policy shifts favoring reduced regulations and increased M&A activities under the Trump administration. Given that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a major player in the tech sector, this news is likely to have a positive impact on its stock price. The article specifically mentions that the technology sector is expected to be a big winner due to a more favorable regulatory environment and increased M&A activity. However, it also acknowledges some potential risks associated with automakers, retailers, and construction, which introduces a slight level of caution.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and its potential impact on the stock market. Although Apple Inc. is not directly mentioned, the tech industry and related companies such as Microsoft, Alphabet, and Nvidia are discussed. The article highlights the potential for Trump's policies to impact the market and the possibility of interest rate changes. Given the broad discussion of the tech industry and the potential for market volatility, I estimate the probability of Apple's stock price rising or falling based on the overall market sentiment and the potential impact of the discussions at Davos on the tech industry. The presence of big bank CEOs and their outlook on interest rates, as well as the discussions on artificial intelligence and crypto, may influence the market. However, without direct mention of Apple, the impact on its stock price is uncertain. Considering the mixed predictions from other models and the lack of direct information about Apple in the news, I assign a moderate probability to both a rise and a fall in stock price.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos",

  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.45
}
```
